newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING sees 1996 EPS up seven to 12 pct.
newsitem.headline: ING sees 1996 EPS up seven to 12 pct.

text.p: Financial services group ING Groep NV (ING) said earnings per share in 1996 would be between seven and 12 percent higher than in 1995.
In a statement issued earlier in Dutch, ING used the term "duidelijk" to describe the expected increase in EPS in 1996 compared with 1995.

ING's corporate communications manager Ruud Polet said this term translated into "clearly" in English and that in the Netherlands this was meant to indicate an increase in the range of seven to 12 percent.
"'Clearly' means seven to 12 percent," he told Reuters.
ING's EPS in 1995 were 3.84 guilders, allowing for the 2.5-for-one share split earlier this year.

ING earlier announced a net profit of 2.34 billion guilders for the first nine months of 1996, compared with 1.88 billion a year earlier. EPS rose to 3.23 guilders from 2.75 for the same period in 1995.
